definition: a putout of a base runner who is required to run, impose urgently, importunately, or inexorably
details:
noun
- a putout of a base runner who is required to run
= synonyms: force out
- an act of aggression, as one against a person who resists
= example: an act of aggression, as one against a person who resists
= synonyms: violence
- (of a law) having legal validity
= synonyms: effect
- physical energy or intensity
= example: physical energy or intensity
= synonyms: forcefulness, strength
- a powerful effect or influence
= example: a powerful effect or influence
- a unit that is part of some military service
= example: a unit that is part of some military service
= synonyms: military unit, military force, military group
- a group of people having the power of effective action
= example: a group of people having the power of effective action
- group of people willing to obey orders
= example: group of people willing to obey orders
= synonyms: personnel
- one possessing or exercising power or influence or authority
= synonyms: power
- (physics) the influence that produces a change in a physical quantity
= example: (physics) the influence that produces a change in a physical quantity
verb
- impose urgently, importunately, or inexorably
= example: impose urgently, importunately, or inexorably
= synonyms: thrust
- do forcibly
= example: do forcibly
- cause to move by pulling
= synonyms: pull
- force into or from an action or state, either physically or metaphorically
= synonyms: drive
- squeeze like a wedge into a tight space
= synonyms: squeeze, wedge
- take by force
= synonyms: take, storm
- urge or force (a person) to an action
= synonyms: impel
- move with force, 'He pushed the table into a corner'
= synonyms: push
- to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means :'She forced him to take a job in the city'
= synonyms: pressure
